com.mousebird.maply

Class ParticleSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.ParticleSystem

  • public class ParticleSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A particle system is used to spawn large numbers of small moving objects.
    The particle system defines what the objects are and how they're controlled. Actual data is handled through the ParticleBatch.
    You set up a particle system and then add ParticleBatches via a view controller.

      • setLifetime

        public void setLifetime(double lifetime)
        Sets the particle lifetime. The system will try to keep particles around for this long. Individual particle lifetime.
        The created particles will last only a certain amount of time.
        Parameters:
        lifetime -

      • setBasetime

        public void setBasetime(double basetime)
        Particles move over time, but current time is a large number. This is the base time you can use to subtract from current time values.
        Individual particles will measure their own lifetime against this base value.
        Parameters:
        basetime -

      • getBasetime

        public double getBasetime()
        Particles move over time, but current time is a large number. This is the base time you can use to subtract from current time values.
        Returns:
        The base that particle time is measured from.

      • setTotalParticles

        public void setTotalParticles(int totalParticles)
        The total number of particles to display at once. These will be broken up into batchSized chunks.
        This is the most particles we'll have on the screen at any time. Space will be allocated for them, so don't overdo it.
        Parameters:
        totalParticles - Total number of particles to be represented at once.

      • getTotalParticles

        public int getTotalParticles()
        Total number of particles to display at once.

      • setBatchSize

        public void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
        Size of the individual batches you add when adding particles. The total number of particles should be a multiple of this.
        Particles need to be created in large batches for efficiency. This is the size of individual batches.
        Parameters:
        batchSize - Batch size for ParticleBatch.

      • getBatchSize

        public int getBatchSize()
        Size of the individual batches you add when adding particles.
        Returns:
        Total number of particles to be represented at once.

      • setContinuousUpdate

        public void setContinuousUpdate(boolean cRender)
        Turn the continuous render on or off. By default the particle system is going to move all the particles all the time. This means the renderer must execute every frame. There are times where this is not appropriate (e.g. stars) and so we can turn it off.

      • setDrawPriority

        public void setDrawPriority(int drawPriority)
        Set the draw priority for the particles

      • setPointSize

        public void setPointSize(float pointSize)
        Set the point size if the particle system is points.

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         Shader.AttributeType type)
        Add an attribute that will appear in each batch. Attributes are data values that go into each and every particle.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute we'll look for in each batch.
        type - Type of the attribute.

      • addVarying

        public void addVarying(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String inputName,
                       Shader.AttributeType type)
        For two stage shaders, these are the varying outputs from one shader to the next.
        Two stage shaders run a position shader and then a regular render shader from the position output. Add any varying values you want to share per vertex from the former to the latter.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the varying output
        inputName - Name of the input to the next shader
        type - Data type of the varying

      • addTexture

        public void addTexture(MaplyTexture tex)
        Add a texture to the particle system.
        All the textures will be handed over to the shader.

      • addTextureID

        public void addTextureID(long texID)
        Add a texture to the shader by ID.

      • setZBufferWrite

        If set, we'll write to the z buffer.

      • setRenderTarget

        public void setRenderTarget(RenderTarget target)
